result.execSummary:
The defendant James S Poremba was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $50/month commencing November 15, 2015 and the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James S Poremba

defendant.name: Poremba, James S
defendant.address: N82w13300 Fond Du Lac Ave Apt5, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def appeared in person.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def is unable to obtain DL for medical reasons.  Agreement reached.  Def waives right to counsel; Court accepts waiver.  Def acknowledges prior Operate w/out Valid DL conviction.  Def enters guilty plea.  Court finds def guilty.  State moves to dismiss and read-in 15TR1364; Court so orders.  Statements from State and def.  Court imposes fine of $579 to be paid at rate of $50/mo comm 11-15-15 or civil judgment shall enter.    Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP.  CASE RECALLED.  Pretrial held; Def needs time to obtain DL.  Def continues atty waiver; Court accepts waiver.  Court sets $1000 signature bond.  Adj to allow def time to obtain DL.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Statements from def.  Case to be recalled.
